medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset diffuse abdominal pain for 1 day.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain started around 7 AM when the patient awoke. The patient has chronic pain in the left lower quadrant (LLQ) but this pain was more severe, similar in character, and originally started in the LLQ before moving to the right lower quadrant (RLQ). The pain is not associated with food, and the patient reports having vomited some bile.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, Diabetes Mellitus type II, Chronic Kidney Disease stage II, Gastroesophageal reflux disease, history of diverticulitis status post sigmoidectomy, obstructive sleep apnea on CPAP, gout, depression, urge incontinence, arthritis status post hip and knee replacements, hysterectomy, and bilateral cataract surgeries.
